com.r3.corda.networkmanage.common.shell

Class ShellCommandHandler

  • com.r3.corda.networkmanage.common.shell.ShellCommandHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ShellCommands

    public class ShellCommandHandler
implements ShellCommands

    This class allows for interacting with an interactive shell by invoking external methods, as well as retrieving user input.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ShellCommandHandler(Renderer renderer)
      This class allows for interacting with an interactive shell by invoking external methods, as well as retrieving user input.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Boolean getBooleanInput(java.lang.String promptString)
      Prompts the user for boolean input (Y/N), returning the appropriate boolean value or null if user cancelled. renderer is the class responsible for rendering the user options on the screen and reading user input.
      Renderer getRenderer() 
      java.lang.String getStringInput(java.lang.String promptString, java.util.Set<java.lang.String> possibleValues)
      Prompts the user for input, printing the promptString. Validates the input is not null or blank, re-requesting input if invalid. Also validates that input is one of the given possibleValues (if not null). renderer is the class responsible for rendering the user options on the screen and reading user input.
      void showMenu(MenuOptions menuOptions)
      Parses all labels and the associated methods to be called to construct a menu which will be displayed via the renderer.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.r3.corda.networkmanage.common.shell.ShellCommands

        getBooleanInput, getStringInput, showMenu

    • Constructor Detail

      • ShellCommandHandler

        public ShellCommandHandler(Renderer renderer)

        This class allows for interacting with an interactive shell by invoking external methods, as well as retrieving user input.

    • Method Detail

      • showMenu

        public void showMenu(MenuOptions menuOptions)

        Parses all labels and the associated methods to be called to construct a menu which will be displayed via the renderer.

        Parameters:
        menuOptions - A list of pairs containing the command label to be displayed and the linked method to be invoked.

      • getStringInput

        public java.lang.String getStringInput(java.lang.String promptString,
                                       java.util.Set<java.lang.String> possibleValues)

        Prompts the user for input, printing the promptString. Validates the input is not null or blank, re-requesting input if invalid. Also validates that input is one of the given possibleValues (if not null). renderer is the class responsible for rendering the user options on the screen and reading user input.

        Returns:
        validated user input, or null if user cancelled
        See Also:
        renderer

      • getBooleanInput

        public java.lang.Boolean getBooleanInput(java.lang.String promptString)

        Prompts the user for boolean input (Y/N), returning the appropriate boolean value or null if user cancelled. renderer is the class responsible for rendering the user options on the screen and reading user input.

        See Also:
        renderer

      • getRenderer

        public Renderer getRenderer()
